duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintain the ongoing operational databases (SQL Server, DB2) to ensure system performance, availability, reliability, security, recoverability, change management, and regulatory compliance.
Provide database solutions to solve complex business issues, including data processing, loading, performance improvements, data storage, and data replication.
Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve database-related issues, including storage, performance, availability, data integrity, and database security.
Automate database management, maintenance, and data processing activities.
Create, modify, maintain, and optimize database objects such as indexes, tables, partitions, triggers, constraints, stored procedures, and views.
Evaluate releases of DB2, MS SQL Server, and third-party products to ensure that the organization is running the most appropriate products.
Collaborate with technical/non-technical resources for project work, POCs (Proofs of Concept), and troubleshooting exercises.
Analyze Operating System statistics and troubleshoot performance-related problems on storage, I/O throughput, and OS kernel parameters.
Adapt new automation technologies and implement the same.
Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation and escalate issues as needed.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or other technical discipline. Technical Certifications are a plus.
